result.execSummary:
The defendant John C. Fox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  TIME SERVED
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John C. Fox

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court states case.  Hoffman and Steinman state appearances.  Linda A Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John C. Fox in court with attorney Thomas L Steinman.  Hoffman addresses Court; agreement has been reached.  Hoffman states agreement.  Steinman agrees with recommendation.   John Fox enters a No contest Plea to Count 1.  Fox advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:
$443.00 fine/costs (includes $200.00 DNA surcharge).  Cash bond to be applied.
Two (2) Days in Sauk County Jail, with Huber, consecutive.  Two (2) days credit - time served.  

Count 2:
Dismissed but read in.

Count 3:
Dismissed but read in.

Paperwork handed in court.
Preliminary hearing on June 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant John C. Fox by video from LEC with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Defendant John C. Fox in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE hasn't applied for PD yet.  Defense waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Woodard responds/requests $150 cash bond if any.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
